header: Accessibility Statement for Ending a tenancy due to immigration status
intro-p2: This service is run by the Home Office. We want as many people as possible to be able to use this service. For example, that means you should be able to:
reporting-p1: We’re always looking to improve the accessibility of our services. If you find any problems not listed on this page or think we’re not meeting accessibility requirements, email:
enforcement-p1-link: contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS)
enforcement-p2: If you are in Northern Ireland and are not happy with how we respond to your complaint you can contact the Equalities Commission for Northern Ireland who are responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the ‘accessibility regulations’) in Northern Ireland.
technical-info-p1: The Home Office is committed to making its online services accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.
compliance-p1: This service is partially compliant with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 due to the non-compliances listed below.
non-compliance-li1: We are aware of and working to address the following issues.
non-compliance-li2: On several pages, we have identified an issue where some elements may not function as expected (use invalid ARIA roles) which may cause screen readers to misinterpret or ignore these elements. This does not meet WCAG 4.1.2 – Name, Role, Value.
non-compliance-li4: If you find an issue that we have yet to identify, please contact us using one of the routes described in the ‘Reporting accessibility problems with this website’ section of this statement.
preparation-p1: This statement was prepared on 1 June 2020. It was last reviewed on 18 March 2025.
preparation-p2: This website was last tested on 2 April 2024. The test was carried out internally by the Home Office.
